title: An employer questioning an applicant
context: Ask a candidate challenging questions during a job interview.

content.bestLine: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

neutral.text: Can you tell me about yourself?
Why do you want this job?
How would you handle a difficult situation?
What do you know about our company?
Why are you leaving your current job?
Can you give an example of your work?

formal.text: What relevant experience do you have?
Can you describe your management style?
How do you stay current in your field?
What are your expectations for this role?
What do you think are the most important qualities for this position?

patterns.template: What [options] would you bring to this role?
Can you give an example of a time when [options]?
options: you had to make a difficult decision

lines.speaker: Employer
lines.text: Can you tell me about your previous work experience?

lines.speaker: Candidate
lines.text: Yes, I have been working in the industry for five years.

lines.speaker: Employer
lines.text: What are your long-term career goals?

lines.speaker: Candidate
lines.text: I hope to become a leader in my field and make significant contributions.
